metadata.synopsis: Astarion discuss a possibility of controlling the tadpole.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: You know, I feel a connection between us. Like we're two souls walking the same path.
77.context: NodeContext: Trying to ingratiate himself to the player

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: Every step we walk trails blood. Killing is an instinct for us. I respect you for that.
59.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers if the tieflings were defeatedNodeContext: slight pause before 'situation', as he considers how to describe the player deciding to kill a whole bunch of tieflings.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: I would keep the murders in our own camp to a minimum, but otherwise we're very much on the same page.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: The way you dealt with the refugee situation showed you can make the choices that need to be made.
48.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers if the tieflings were defeatedNodeContext: slight pause before 'situation', as he considers how to describe the player deciding to kill a whole bunch of tieflings.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: And that you're a cold-blooded killer. Which I respect.
13.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

54.speaker: Player
54.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I do what I have to to survive, that's all.
65.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: We both want to survive. But why merely survive when you can thrive?

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: Just think - how many others are walking around infected with these parasites? Hundreds? Thousands?

50.speaker: Player
50.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: I just worry that we're not considering all our options when it comes to our uninvited guests.
25.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: How many people are infected with them, do you think? Hundreds? Thousands?
4.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: And they're not just goblin trash - there are powerful people in the worms' thrall.
40.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: Whoever's waiting for us at Moonrise Towers controls it all. But if we can take that control from them, imagine the power we'd wield.
37.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Hmm. It is a tempting idea...
9.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: Isn't it? Imagine, the entire cult under our thumb.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: I'm just saying there's an opportunity before us. If we can control the tadpoles, we can keep ourselves safe and enjoy a little world domination on the side.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: You can't tell me that doesn't sound fun.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: I knew I was right about you. It's so good to find a kindred spirit.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: Of course, this all assumes we live long enough to find this 'Moonrise'. But I'm feeling optimistic.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Do. It's not often the universe hands you something like this - we'd be fools to squander it.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I still want to get rid of the parasite.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: A pity, I thought you had more ambition than that.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: Still, we're not there yet. Maybe you'll see the light yet.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: And how would we do that, exactly?
11.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: I mean - I assume there's some device controlling these things, so we find that, murder some people, and...
16.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound like he knows what he's talking about, though he doesn't actually have a plan beyond "stealing power good",

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: Look, I'm not a 'details' person, all right? But turning up and causing chaos has worked for us so far.
70.context: NodeContext: giving up trying to sound authoratitive

23.speaker: Player
23.text: It sounds like fun until we all turn into mind flayers.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: That's just the thing - if we control the parasites, then we can order them not to change us. All the power with none of the tentacles.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I'm getting this thing out of my head. End of story.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I didn't think you liked me at all.

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: How could I not? We are both veritable terrors on society.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: But with all the effort we've put into wanton brutality, don't you think that we could be more?

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: You might be a little naive in the ways of the world, but I see promise in you. Ambition.
75.context: NodeContext: With a sigh, maybe pinching the bridge of his nose because the player is so fucking dense. But Astarion is trying to get the player on board with stealing a whole lot of power, so he has to lead them down the path and can't just call them an idiot.

67.speaker: Player
67.context: NodeContext: With a sigh, maybe pinching the bridge of his nose because the player is so fucking dense. But Astarion is trying to get the player on board with stealing a whole lot of power, so he has to lead them down the path and can't just call them an idiot.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: Just that you... have a big heart. You like doing what's right.
29.context: NodeContext: With a sigh, maybe pinching the bridge of his nose because the player is so fucking dense. But Astarion is trying to get the player on board with stealing a whole lot of power, so he has to lead them down the path and can't just call them an idiot.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: So I was thinking, what would be the right thing to do when we get to Moonrise Towers? When we come face-to-face with whoever is controlling the parasites in our heads.
19.context: NodeContext: With a sigh, maybe pinching the bridge of his nose because the player is so fucking dense. But Astarion is trying to get the player on board with stealing a whole lot of power, so he has to lead them down the path and can't just call them an idiot.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: To destroy the cult and end its evil forever.
68.context: NodeContext: With a sigh, maybe pinching the bridge of his nose because the player is so fucking dense. But Astarion is trying to get the player on board with stealing a whole lot of power, so he has to lead them down the path and can't just call them an idiot.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: Gods... No, try to think outside the box. Just a little.
43.context: NodeContext: With a sigh, maybe pinching the bridge of his nose because the player is so fucking dense. But Astarion is trying to get the player on board with stealing a whole lot of power, so he has to lead them down the path and can't just call them an idiot.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: Consider the parasites in our skulls and think - how many others have the mind flayers infected? Hundreds? Thousands?

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'm going to get rid of this worm and then get back to my life.
74.context: NodeContext: Surprised and hyped that the player got it in one. He didn't think you'd be on board with the idea

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: That's the obvious option, yes, but consider the alternatives.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Seize control of the cult ourselves?
53.context: NodeContext: Surprised and hyped that the player got it in one. He didn't think you'd be on board with the idea

10.speaker: Astarion
10.context: NodeContext: Surprised and hyped that the player got it in one. He didn't think you'd be on board with the idea

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: Just think, how many people have the mind flayers infected? Hundreds? Thousands?
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't quite find the words to convey "even evil people can be a little bit good" so just mimes weighing scales with his handsNodeContext: "And even good or evil people can be a little bit complicated."

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Evil power. I won't do it.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't quite find the words to convey "even evil people can be a little bit good" so just mimes weighing scales with his handsNodeContext: "And even good or evil people can be a little bit complicated."

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: Power is just a tool, it's people that are good or evil.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't quite find the words to convey "even evil people can be a little bit good" so just mimes weighing scales with his handsNodeContext: "And even good or evil people can be a little bit complicated."

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: And even they can be a little bit...
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't quite find the words to convey "even evil people can be a little bit good" so just mimes weighing scales with his handsNodeContext: "And even good or evil people can be a little bit complicated."

26.speaker: Player
26.text: And how would we do that, exactly?
26.context: NodeContext: pause be 'liberate' as he considers what would sound good to a goody-two-shoes player. Astarion was thinking less liberate, more dominate

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Until we transform into mind flayers, you mean.
56.context: NodeContext: pause be 'liberate' as he considers what would sound good to a goody-two-shoes player. Astarion was thinking less liberate, more dominate

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: I'm just saying there's an opportunity here. If we can control the tadpoles, we can keep ourselves safe and liberate the world from this evil.
33.context: NodeContext: pause be 'liberate' as he considers what would sound good to a goody-two-shoes player. Astarion was thinking less liberate, more dominate

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: So much for thinking you had ambition.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Or we could just enjoy having all that power.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Trust me, I'm nothing like you.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Well, no, I was being generous. But you're not beyond hope.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Such a strong word. We have our differences, but we don't have to, do we?
